SUMMARY: Hns-dependent flhDCregulator, HdfR, negatively regulates expression of flagellar master operon, flhDC [10913108] and positively regulates expression of gltBD operon [21034467]. H-NS is a direct activator of flhDC operon and represses transcription of hdfR. HdfR is a transcriptional regulator that belongs to LysR family. It consist of two domains, an amino-terminal domain that contains a potential helix-turn-helix DNA-binding motif and a carboxy-terminal domain involved in co-inducer recognition [10913108, 8257110]. Little is known about regulatory role of HdfR, and binding sites for this transcription factor have not yet been determined. In systematic studies of oligomerization, it was shown that some members of LysR family, like HdfR, interact with or members of family to form heterodimers, but physiological significance of this is unknown [21187915].
